narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Juan Carlos Penagos Zuluaga  He could have been more involved in class discussions.
Instructor: Juan Carlos Penagos Zuluaga  I don't have enough information to say.

Instructor: Juan Carlos Penagos Zuluaga   As a discussion-based class, there was little need to contact Juan outside of class times, which he was present for (either in person or via skype). During discussion sessions that he led, Juan had general points identified ahead of time in order to help direct the discussion as necessary.
Instructor: Juan Carlos Penagos Zuluaga  He was a good TA.
Instructor: Juan Carlos Penagos Zuluaga  Juan was helpful, especially when the professor was absent. Sometimes he clarified concepts through asking follow-up questions during discussion.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I took this course as a way to explore other topics, not necessarily related to my interests. So, although it wasn't relevant to my course of study, the course was interesting.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The small size was very conducive to discussion.
The readings and short responses each week were great. The class discussions were helpful as well.

I would highly recommend this class to other students. There are multiple benefits -- wide range of subject matter, interesting topics, reasonable workload, emphasis on critical and thorough readings of journal articles, and good discussion in-class.
Open discussion
Disease/pests in multiple contexts, including ecology, genetics, agriculture, and human health.
Extremely interesting.
Very good spread of topics. Good moderation by instructor.
The readings were very interesting, as was the discussion.

Overall, I thought that this course was amazing. LC did an incredible job presenting the material and leading discussion. It was fun, interesting, and could not recommend it more highly (assuming your interested deeply in the subject material). I wish there were more classes taught at FES with this style and structure. I think one of the greatest aspects of this course is the fact that it is entirely discussion based. I loved how discussions were NOT contrived, with particular students leading discussion, while no one else reads the material. Participation by everyone was really engaging. Very much a self-learner structured course. Light on assessment, but heavy on engagement.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: It might be nice to offer this class for a full three credits (maybe multiple enrollment options, with an additional project for those who would like to take this as a full three-credit class).
More balance in the paper topic selection: Less public health focus more forest health. Possibly include plant communication and case studies in urban greenery topics
Some papers, especially those on genetics, were too jargony or specialized for students of multiple backgrounds to grasp well.
None.
Perhaps the discussion could benefit from more organization. For example, the professor might benefit from reviewing the main concepts of each reading before opening up the class for questions.
It is hard for me to pick out areas of this course that need improvement. While I know that it might not be possible but maybe 2 weeks of mind-altering parasites!?

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA
The course had few traditional lectures, in favor of a discussion format. Guest lecturers included discussions as part of their plans -- so, a highly effective relationship.
NA

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This class provides a solid grounding/review in ecological theory; even in cases where subject matter is not directly applicable, these themes are consistent throughout environmental science.

The course does not really relate to my overall program, which is part of the reason why I took it. I wanted to refresh my skills in reading scientific papers and evaluating them, which this course allowed me to do.
This is a great secondary course to discussion ecological concepts as they apply to pests and pathogens.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interest and relevance to my research
I was primarily drawn by the advertised subject matter, and have a longtime interest in pathogen/parasite influences on ecosystems.
Pests, pathogens in forest/ urban greenery context.
Personal fascination with the topic.
Seemed cool.
I took this course to, as aforementioned, refresh my ability to read and evaluate scientific papers and concepts.
Interested in the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes -- if anything, my expectations were exceeded.
As far as seminars go, yes. In general, I found the course more interesting than exceptionally helpful for my research.
Yes.
Went beyond my expectations, widened my view of interactions between pathogens and their hosts.
Yes, the content was very interesting and changed my way of thinking.
They far exceeded by expectations. I was hesitant at first about this course but it proved to be only of the most engaging and interesting courses I took all semester.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: NA
NA

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: TAKE IT!!! This was my favorite class of the semester. Set aside time each week to thoroughly and critically read the assigned papers. Reading is good for you.
Take it.
You might consider reviewing basic ecology concepts just so that you're able to contribute to the discussion on a more advanced level.
Take it!!!
